titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Gano George, Indictment
CWG6508

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
State of Kentucky
Grant Circuit Court.
May Term 1865.
Commonwealth of Ky. Pltff.
against } Indictment
Gano George Deft.

The defendant having been duly summoned and called, came not but made default. and thereupon a Jury came towit. J. E. Boswell, J. H. Wilson, Jerry Reediell, W. H. Conner, V. Franks, H. Kendall, C. D. Reed, D. Bogs, John Mitts, Thomas Bickers, John Beagle & G. W. Nichols, who were sworn well and truly to try and a true verdict render, and after hearing the evidence retired to their room and returned the following verdict We of the Jury find the defendant guilty, and assess the fine at one hundred dollars.

It is therefore adjudged by the court that the defendant make good his fine to the Commonwealth by the payment of One hundred dollars, in manner and form by the Jurors aforesaid assessed and also her costs herein expended, and that Capias issue.

A copy att
N. H. Jeffers C. G. C. C.

Grant Cir Ct
Commonwealth
vs } Copy of Judgt.
Gano. George
